events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical bills expected over the next few months.
The loan application was categorised under personal loans following the mention of medical expenses in the request.
A loan officer was assigned to this case to assist with processing the personal loan application promptly.
The initial review examined the applicant's financial documents and loan purpose in detail for personal loan suitability.
Additional documentation was requested from the applicant to verify income and recent medical expenses.
Applicant submitted all requested documents including medical bills and income statements for loan evaluation.
A credit check was carried out on the applicant to assess creditworthiness for the personal loan request.
Risk assessment was completed considering applicant's credit score and medical expense-related loan needs.
A loan offer with terms and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review and acceptance.
Applicant responded positively to the offer, with some questions about early repayment fees.
Application was escalated to underwriting due to applicant's request for clarification on early repayment policies.
The loan was approved following successful underwriting and confirmation of applicantâ€™s understanding of terms.
Funds were disbursed to the applicant's bank account to cover medical bills as requested in the personal loan.
Follow-up contact made to ensure the applicant is satisfied with the loan disbursement and has no further questions.
The loan application process was closed successfully after confirmation of applicant satisfaction and fund receipt.
